full_summary:
### Government of Canada Tender Announcement
#### Reference Number: PW-22-01017792

### Overview

The government of Canada is inviting contractors to submit proposals for the delivery of trap and data collection services at Big Creek. This project is part of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans’ (DFO) ongoing efforts to protect the fisheries of the Great Lakes and prevent the spread of invasive species.

### Background

The DFO has been involved in the sea lamprey control program since 1955 and plays a vital role in the binational program coordinated by the Great Lakes Fishery Commission (GLFC). The objective of this program is to protect the fisheries of the Great Lakes, which have an estimated economic benefit of $7 billion annually.

### Project Scope

The selected contract will involve operating sea lamprey traps at Big Creek, conducting a mark-recapture study with the captured sea lampreys, and collecting and providing raw data to estimate population sizes in the stream. The project will run from March 15 to August 1, 2023, and may extend to 2024-2026.

### Required Deliverables

The contractor will be required to provide the following:

* Operate sea lamprey traps at Big Creek
* Conduct a mark-recapture study with the captured sea lampreys
* Collect and provide raw data for population estimates
* Ensure proper functioning of the traps and fishway
* Remove, identify, and count fishes and invertebrates captured in the traps
* Calculate and report the number of sea lampreys captured and recaptured in the traps
* Conduct environmental data collection
* Complete a daily report for each trap visit

### Contractor Responsibilities

The contractor is responsible for ensuring that all equipment is in good working order, transporting equipment and materials to and from the site, and maintaining accurate records of data collected.

### Resources and Effort

The contractor is expected to provide the minimum resources required to complete the project. A vehicle capable of transporting lamps up to 225 kg and freezers for storing tagged sea lampreys are required. The contractor is also responsible for ensuring that all staff are trained on proper handling and safety procedures.

### Contracting Entity
